intro: Rinorea ebolowensis, commonly known as the Cameroon rose. It is a flowering plant species native to Cameroon, belonging to the Malvaceae family. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically ovate to elliptical in shape, with a smooth texture. Rinorea ebolowensis is often found in moist, shaded environments within tropical rainforests.
